meanings.definition: Past tense of overdrive: drove or pushed too hard or too far.
meanings.sent1: She overdrove the car and ended up with a flat tire.
meanings.sent2: He overdrove the team during practice, causing them to be exhausted.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overdrove itself trying to gather too many nuts at once.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition overdrove her to work late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The storm overdrove the river, causing it to flood the nearby fields.

meanings.definition: Past participle of overdrive: driven or pushed too hard or too far.
meanings.sent1: The overdrove engine finally gave out on the old truck.
meanings.sent2: The overdrove horse collapsed from exhaustion after the long race.
meanings.sent3: The overdrove computer crashed after running too many programs at once.
meanings.sent4: His overdrove determination led him to achieve great success.
meanings.sent5: The overdrove machine sputtered and stopped, unable to handle the workload.
